Summary: Orange glowing bell or pear like shape object traveling from NW to SE. Constant orange glow, no sound.
trends: There have been 4 other sightings in Camas
There were no other sightings in Camas on or around July 3rd 2010
divs: sighting detailsmy kids and i went outside in front of the house to watch fireworks some of the meighbors were lighting off the night before the 4th. my son said look at that floating fire ball, it looks like a firework is still burning. my daughter and i were looking south and turned to the northwest and sure enough, it looked like a floating ember. as i studied it, the orange glow was constant, the same color as a flame. the shape was pear or bell like and was not flickering or flashing, no becon's or strobe lights, and was silent. it was moving slower than a single engine airplane, but faster than the breeze through the neighborhood. we watched it for about 2 minutes traveling from the northwest to the southeast until we couldn't see it anymore. i'd guess it may have been about 1000 feet up and maybe a quarter mile away. there was no change in speed, altitude or the color\brightness, and i can definitively say it was not an airplane or burning ember from a firework.
